title: DOGE Analysis: £3.4M in Duplicates, £1.1M to Non-Compliant Suppliers, and a 12.9x Year-End Spike
summary: Our comprehensive DOGE-style audit of 29,802 spending records totalling £211 million has uncovered duplicate payments, Companies House compliance failures, and the worst year-end spending surge in East Lancashire.
author: Hyndburn Council Transparency

title: £1.1 Million Paid to Suppliers With No Active Directors at Companies House
summary: Hyndburn paid £420,200 to B3P Services Ltd while it had no active directors — and £1.1 million in total to 17 suppliers during active Companies House breaches. Some had no directors AND no person with significant control.
author: Hyndburn Council Transparency

title: £3.4 Million in Likely Duplicate Payments Across 940 Groups
summary: Analysis of Hyndburn's spending data reveals 940 duplicate payment groups totalling £3.4 million — the highest value of any East Lancashire council. HM Land Registry alone has 2,422 tiny transactions averaging £5 each.
author: Hyndburn Council Transparency

title: 12.9x Year-End Spending Spike: The Worst in East Lancashire
summary: Hyndburn's Regeneration & Housing department spent 12.9 times its monthly average in March — £3.7 million above normal. This is the worst year-end spending surge of any department across Hyndburn, Burnley, and Pendle.
author: Hyndburn Council Transparency

title: Cross-Council Comparison: 37 Shared Suppliers and a 115,237% Price Gap
summary: Hyndburn shares 37 suppliers with Burnley and Pendle, with combined spending of £28.1 million. Price comparisons reveal extreme variations — one supplier charges Burnley 115,237% more than Pendle for equivalent services.
author: Hyndburn Council Transparency
